page.title: 07Customs
page.content: Not many local customs survive in this area. Harvest festivals are held each year with harvest suppers, followed by an auction of all the produce brought. The proceeds go towards church funds. These are occasions when everyone joins in. Funerals are usually very large, everyone wishing to pay their last respects. The local paper always carries a full report with a list of all those attending. Once hop picking time meant that many people from Birmingham and the Black Country came here to help with the harvest.but the customs that evolved have lapsed with the widespread introduction of machinery. One custom that is still prevalent is the hanging of sprays of hops in the home. These are usually burnt at Christmas on the Yule log. Autumn fairs are still held but these are no longer hiring fairs.
